UX.title: 100 Things Every Designer Needs to Know About People
UX.author: Susan Weinschenk

HTML.title: Design with Bootstrap
HTML.author: Ammar Darwish
HTML.description: Responsive design is a web development approach that ensures web pages display well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes. Bootstrap is a popular framework that makes it easy to create responsive and mobile-friendly websites. It provides a grid system, pre-built components and styles to easily create responsive layouts without reinventing the wheel.

HTML.title: HTML - An Introduction
HTML.author: Ammar Darwish
HTML.description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is a standard markup language used to create web pages and web applications. It uses various tags and attributes to provide the structure and content of a web page. Introduction to HTML covers topics such as the basic structure of HTML documents, text formatting, links, images, lists, tables, forms, and HTML5 semantic elements.

CSS.title: CSS - An Introduction
CSS.author: Ammar Darwish
CSS.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used to describe the appearance of documents written in HTML or XML. CSS describes how elements are rendered on screen, paper, speech, or other media. Introduction to CSS covers topics like selectors, properties, values, box model, positioning, layout techniques, and responsive design.

JavaScript.title: JavaScript - An Introduction
JavaScript.author: Ammar Darwish
JavaScript.description: JavaScript is a programming language that allows you to create dynamic and interactive web content. Introduction to JavaScript covers basic concepts such as variables, data types, operators, control structures, functions, arrays, objects, and DOM manipulation. Event handling, asynchronous programming, and error handling are also covered.

JavaScript.title: JavaScript for Kids: A Playful Introduction to Programming
JavaScript.author: Nick Morgan
